EmailTemplate.name: ENG-QoS-Nurture.ENG-QOS-Early-02.02-Challenge-of-QOS
EmailTemplate.subject: Is It Even Possible To Guarantee Quality of Service?
EmailTemplate.textOnly: <[[http://turbonomic.com/blog/on-technology/the-unbearable-lightness-of-quality-of-service?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ENG-QOS&utm_content=Early02]]> HiÂ {{lead.First Name:default=There}}, The notion of measuring Quality Of Service (QoS) was first seen in telephony and computer networks. The telecommunications industry became the first to measure and hold themselves to the service levels demanded by their customers. But as service offerings become more complex, along with the environments behind them, does the notion of QoS still make sense? And if so, is it even possible to measure in the modern data center? Click to below to learn more <[[http://turbonomic.com/blog/on-technology/the-unbearable-lightness-of-quality-of-service?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ENG-QOS&utm_content=Early02]]> - The Turbonomic Team
